bestBHT.bht: This genealogy refers to the lineage from David to Adam and includes Nathan. Other biblical references, such as 2 Samuel 5:14, 1 Chronicles 3:5, and Zechariah 12:12, shed more light on the significance of Nathan in this genealogy. For a more detailed account, consult 1 Chronicles 1:2.

Philip Schaff: Luke 3:31. Nathan. Comp. 2Sa 5:14 ; 1 Chronicles 3:5; Zechariah 12:12. On the genealogy from David back to Adam, comp. 1 Chronicles 1:2

bhtAttempts.bht: This verse is part of the genealogy from David back to Adam. It mentions Nathan, who is compared to the Nathan in 2 Samuel 5:14, 1 Chronicles 3:5, and Zechariah 12:12. For a more detailed genealogy, one can refer to 1 Chronicles 1:2.

This passage traces the lineage from David to Adam, specifically mentioning Nathan. The connection to Nathan can be found in 2 Samuel 5:14, 1 Chronicles 3:5, and Zechariah 12:12. Further details about this genealogy can be found in 1 Chronicles 1:2.
